knowledge.heading: Moral Development Through Suffering
knowledge.description: The text argues that systematic oppression and moral crises serve as catalysts for developing ethical judgment and inner strength. Jane's repeated suffering becomes the foundation for her moral awakening and capacity for independent reasoning.
knowledge.pattern_connection: The retrospective narration allows readers to witness Jane's immediate pain while understanding how these experiences shaped her mature moral framework.

device_examples.quote: Why was I always suffering, always brow-beaten, always accused, forever condemned
device_examples.effect: The repetitive structure emphasizes how systematic oppression becomes the driving force for Jane's moral awakening.

device_examples.quote: my reason, forced by the agonizing stimulus into precocious though transitory power
device_examples.effect: Presents moral crisis as the mechanism that awakens Jane's capacity for ethical judgment.
